de.tum.bgu.lfk.processing.checkbox

Class PCheckBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tum.bgu.lfk.processing.checkbox.PCheckBox

  • public class PCheckBox
extends java.lang.Object
    a simple check box class to use within processing. action handling should by done via the e.g. mouseClicked() functions etc.
    The PCheckBox is always a square.

    the x- and y-coordinate are representing the the center of the PCheckBox
    Since:
    04.07.2014
    Version:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Mathias Jahnke, Technische Universität München, Chair of Cartography

    • Constructor Detail

      • PCheckBox

        public PCheckBox()
        default constructor.
        do not use because at the moment not all attributes can be set via methods.

      • PCheckBox

        public PCheckBox(int x,
         int y,
         int checkBoxSize,
         java.lang.String label,
         processing.core.PApplet p)
        parameterized constructor
        Parameters:
        x - the check box center point in pixel coordinates
        y - the check box center point in pixel coordinates
        label - the string of the check box label
        p - the PApplet on which to draw the check box

    • Method Detail

      • setChecked

        public void setChecked(boolean checked)
        sets the status of the check box
        Parameters:
        checked - true if checked otherwise false

      • isChecked

        public boolean isChecked()
        returns true if the check box is checked
        Returns:
        true if checked otherwise false

      • toggleChecked

        public void toggleChecked()
        changes the status to true if its false and to false if its true. to be used in combination with isInside() and e.g. a mousClicked() event

      • setMarkerSymbol

        public void setMarkerSymbol(MarkerSymbol markerSymbol)
        to set the marker symbol as tickmark or cross
        Parameters:
        markerSymbol -

      • isInside

        public boolean isInside(int x,
               int y)
        checks if the position (x, y) are inside the PCheckBox
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if x and y are inside otherwise false

      • draw

        public void draw()
        draw the PCheckBox to screen. differentiating if it is marked or not
